section.title: Course description
section.content: Course description The aim of this course is to prepare Master Students in Information Technology Engineering to conduct research across the range of IT disciplines such as information systems, information management, big data, data science, security, Internet of Things, Artificial intelligence and Cloud Computing. In this course, the students will learn the basic skills which are essential to become a successful researcher. The objective of the course is to teach research skills in a systematic fashion, early in a student's graduate program. It explains the nature of research, various research strategies, approaches, methods and techniques that are applicable in the fields of IT. This course introduces the principles of research design, research ethics, research methods and techniques of data collection and analysis appropriate to IT research in academic and industry settings. Skills developed and knowledge acquired from this course will prepare students to conduct and communicate their own research, as well as to be knowledgeable and critical interpreters of others' research. We try to provide the students with hints and solutions which could be helpful while facing routine research challenges.
